definitions.definition: the act or process of moving, or a particular action or movement:
examples: The violent motion of the ship upset his stomach.

definitions.definition: a polite way of referring to the process of getting rid of solid waste from the body, or the waste itself:
examples: The nurse asked if her motions were regular.

definitions.definition: to make a signal to someone, usually with your hand or head:
examples: I saw him motion to the man at the door, who quietly left.
